name: Sicilian Eggplant Caponata
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'eggplant, peeled and cut into ½-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped celery'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'canned plum tomatoes, drained and coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green olives, pitted and coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'drained capers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly minced oregano'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced fresh parsley, or to taste'}
steps: Toss eggplant with salt and place in a colander set over a bowl. Let sit, about 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry.. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add celery; cook, stirring often, until softened, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion is soft and lightly golden, about 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a bowl using a slotted spoon.. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in the skillet. Add eggplant and cook, stirring constantly, until lightly browned, 5 minutes.. Stir in celery mixture, tomatoes, olives, capers, tomato paste, and oregano. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered until caponata is thickened, about 15 minutes.. Season caponata with vinegar, sugar, salt, and black pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with parsley.

name: Best Caprese Skewers
ingredients: {'quantity': '20', 'unit': '', 'name': 'grape tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'mozzarella cheese, cubed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': '', 'name': 'toothpicks'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Toss tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, olive oil, basil, salt, and pepper together in a bowl until well coated.. Skewer one tomato and one piece of mozzarella cheese on each toothpick.

name: Air Fryer Arancini
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs, divided'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cooked rice'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': '1/2 teaspoon Highlands Italian cheese sprinkle (optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'fresh mozzarella cheese, cubed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'panko bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Italian seasoning'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'nonstick cooking spray'}
steps: Beat 2 eggs lightly in a large bowl. Stir in rice, Parmesan cheese, butter, cheese sprinkle, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper; mix to combine. Cover and refrigerate the mixture for 20 minutes.. Preheat an air fryer to 370 degrees F (187 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions.. Roll mixture into 1 1/2-inch balls. Press a mozzarella cube into the center of each ball and reshape.. Combine bread crumbs, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper in a shallow dish. Beat remaining egg lightly in a second bowl. Dip each rice ball first into egg, then roll in the bread crumb mixture. Place rice balls in air fryer basket and spray with cooking spray.. Cook in the preheated air fryer for 6 minutes. Increase temperature to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and air fry for 3 more minutes.

name: Prosciutto e Melone (Italian Ham and Melon)
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cantaloupe - seeded and cut into 8 wedges'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'thin slices', 'name': 'prosciutto'}
steps: Remove the flesh from the rind of the cantaloupe; wrap each piece of cantaloupe with a slice of prosciutto. Arrange on a platter and serve cold.

name: Cherry Pepper Poppers
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh cherry peppers'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'sharp provolone cheese, cubed'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'prosciutto, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Slice the tops off of the cherry peppers and carefully remove the seeds, keeping peppers whole. Wrap a cube of cheese with prosciutto, and stuff into a pepper. If there is still room inside the pepper, stuff in more prosciutto. Repeat with remaining peppers.. Place all of the stuffed peppers into a 1 quart jar - or one that your peppers will all fit into, and sprinkle salt over them. Pour in enough olive oil to cover the peppers. Cover, and let stand for 1 hour before eating. Refrigerate leftovers.

name: Antipasti Garlic Bread
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'French baguette'}, {'quantity': '2 to 3', 'unit': None, 'name': 'garlic cloves, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'mozzarella cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes,'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 ounce) package', 'name': 'prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '2 to 3', 'unit': None, 'name': 'basil leaves'}
steps: Preheat the oven’s broiler to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C), and set a rack 6 inches from the heat source. Line a baking sheet with foil. Lay bread slices on the prepared sheet.. Rub peeled garlic cloves over a microplane grater to make a paste. Add garlic paste to a bowl; sprinkle with salt. Add softened butter and mix well. Spread 1 to 2 teaspoons garlic butter on each bread slice.. Broil garlic bread under the preheated broiler until golden, 1 to 3 minutes.. Remove garlic bread from oven to cool slightly on a wire rack. Place mozzarella and tomatoes in a bowl; gently toss mixture, and divide evenly between bread slices. Garnish with prosciutto and basil; serve.

name: Tomato and Mozzarella Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '20', 'unit': '', 'name': 'toothpicks'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': '', 'name': 'grape or cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': '', 'name': 'small balls fresh mozzarella cheese (often labeled bocconcini)'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}
steps: Thread a tomato half, a basil leaf, a mozzarella ball, and another tomato half onto a toothpick. Repeat with remaining ingredients.. Arrange toothpicks on a serving platter and season with salt and pepper.. Mix vinegar and oil together in a small bowl to serve as a dipping sauce.

name: Fried Stuffed Squash Blossoms
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh zucchini blossoms'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'soft goat cheese at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Gruyère cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg yolk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'self-rising flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cornstarch'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ice-cold water, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'vegetable oil for frying, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'all-purpose flour, or as needed'}
steps: Gather all ingredients. Gently rinse the squash blossoms to remove any dirt or debris; remove the stamens as they are bitter and not edible.. Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Prepare a large bowl of ice-cold water. Drop squash blossoms into the boiling water until slightly wilted, 30 to 45 seconds; lift with a slotted spoon and immediately place into the cold water to chill. Remove and drain on paper towels.. Make the filling: Mix goat cheese, Gruyère, egg yolk, pepper, and cayenne together in a bowl until smooth. Spoon into a 1-quart resealable plastic bag, squeeze out the air, and seal the bag. Cut a small corner off the bag.. Gently insert the cut corner of the bag into the open end of a blossom and pipe in about 1 tablespoon filling, making sure it fills all the way to the bottom. Lift petals up and drape over filling to cover completely. Fold any excess petals over the top of the filled blossom to keep them out of the way. Repeat to fill remaining blossoms. Refrigerate until cheese is set and firm, at least 30 minutes.. Meanwhile, make the batter: Combine flour and cornstarch in a mixing bowl. Whisk in ice-cold water, a little at a time, until batter is smooth and has the thickness of pancake batter.. Heat 1 inch oil in a cast iron skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). A drop of batter carefully dripped into the oil should sizzle immediately.. Remove squash blossoms from the refrigerator and dust lightly with all-purpose flour on all sides. Shake off excess flour and dip blossoms in batter. Let excess batter drip off.. Gently lay about six coated squash blossoms on their sides in hot oil and cook until pale golden brown, about 1 minute on the first side and 30 seconds to 1 minute on the remaining sides.. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and repeat to fry remaining blossoms. Let cool slightly before serving.

name: Antipasto
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped cauliflower'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'pearl onions'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped red bell peppers'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped green bell peppers'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped celery'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumbers - peeled, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'carrots, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'pickling spice, wrapped in cheesecloth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'black olives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted green olives'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'canned mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': '(5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'tuna, drained and flaked'}
steps: In a large bowl with enough lightly salted water to cover, place the cauliflower, pearl onions, red bell peppers, green bell peppers, celery and cucumbers. Soak 8 to 12 hours, or overnight.. In a small bowl with enough lightly salted water to cover, place the carrots. Soak 8 to 12 hours, or overnight.. In a large saucepan, place the vegetable oil, vinegar, tomato paste and pickling spice. Bring the mixture to a boil. Drain and rinse the carrots, and place them in the mixture. Boil 10 minutes.. Drain and rinse the vegetables in the cauliflower mixture. Place them into the saucepan. Cook 10 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender but crisp.. Stir black olives, green olives, mushrooms and tuna into the mixture. Remove the mixture from heat. Discard the wrapped pickling spice. While still hot, transfer to sterile containers and refrigerate.

name: Antipasto Squares
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(10 ounce) cans', 'name': 'refrigerated crescent dinner rolls'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'thinly sliced boiled ham'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'thinly sliced provolone cheese'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'thinly sliced Swiss cheese'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'thinly sliced Genoa salami'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'thinly sliced pepperoni sausage'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) jar', 'name': 'roasted red peppers, drained, cut into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 C).. Unroll one package of crescent roll dough; arrange in the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan. Layer ham, provolone cheese, Swiss cheese, salami, pepperoni, and red peppers on top of dough.. Beat eggs lightly in a bowl; stir in Parmesan cheese and black pepper. Pour 3/4 of the egg mixture over peppers. Unroll remaining dough and arrange over the top of the peppers; brush with remaining egg mixture. Cover with aluminum foil.. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake until dough is fluffy and golden brown, another 10 to 20 minutes. Cut into squares; serve warm, or at room temperature.

name: Caprese on a Stick
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pint', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(.6 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'name': 'small fresh mozzarella balls'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'toothpicks'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}
steps: Thread a tomato half, a small piece of basil leaf, and a mozzarella ball onto toothpicks until all ingredients are used. Drizzle the olive oil over the tomato, cheese and basil, leaving the end of the toothpick clean. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

name: Watermelon Caprese Appetizer
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh basil, stems removed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'watermelon, fruit removed with a melon baller'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh mozzarella cheese, cut into small pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Trim basil leaves into small circles about 1 inch in diameter.. Thread watermelon and mozzarella cheese on toothpicks, sandwiching a basil leaf in between. Arrange on a serving plate.. Pour olive oil and balsamic vinegar over toothpicks. Sprinkle salt and black pepper on top.

name: Italian Tuna Spread
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '(4.5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'tuna packed in olive oil, drained'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter at room temperature'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'capers, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped Italian flat-leaf parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon juice (Optional)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Combine tuna, butter, capers, parsley, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper in the bowl of a food processor; process until smooth.

name: Marinated Mushrooms for Antipasto
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'small mushrooms, stemmed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic cloves, pressed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}
steps: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add mushrooms and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Drain and set aside to cool.. Combine olive oil, white wine vinegar, red onion, oregano, thyme, garlic, salt, and pepper in a large jar with a lid. Close the jar and shake well. Add cooked mushrooms and refrigerate at least 5 hours. Remove from refrigerator 10 minutes prior to serving.

name: Antipasto Platter
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'heads', 'name': 'iceberg lettuce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) bottle', 'name': 'Italian-style salad dressing'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'thinly sliced cooked ham'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'sliced provolone cheese'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'Genoa salami, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'Capacola sausage, sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'pepperoni sausage, sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'prosciutto, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'thinly sliced roast beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'marinated artichoke hearts'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(7 ounce) jar', 'name': 'roasted red peppers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'sliced black olives'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced pepperoncini peppers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(5 ounce) jar', 'name': 'sliced pimento-stuffed green olives'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crumbled Gorgonzola cheese'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'mozzarella cheese, sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}
steps: Remove large outer leaves from the heads of lettuce. Arrange approximately 1/3 in a layer on a large serving platter. Sprinkle with 1/3 garlic powder, 1/3 oregano, and desired amount of dressing. Layer with ham and Provolone.. Layer Provolone with another 1/3 of the lettuce, 1/3 garlic powder, 1/3 oregano, desired amount of dressing, salami, and capacola.. Repeat layering with remaining lettuce, garlic powder, oregano, dressing, pepperoni, prosciutto, and roast beef.. Layer with mushrooms, artichokes, roasted red peppers, black olives, pepperoncini, and green olives. Drizzle with more dressing as desired.. Top with Gorgonzola, mozzarella, and Parmesan. Cover and chill in the refrigerator until serving.

name: Grilled Prosciutto-Wrapped Peaches with Burrata and Basil
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ripe, sweet (but not soft) freestone peaches'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'thin slices', 'name': 'prosciutto, or more as needed, torn into ribbons'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'bamboo skewers, soaked in water 20 minutes'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'burrata cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil, for drizzling'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Coarse sea salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Freshly ground black pepper, to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'finely sliced fresh basil leaves'}
steps: Preheat an outdoor grill at medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.. Cut peaches in half and remove peach stones. Cut each half in half again.. Wrap prosciutto around each peach section; secure with small bamboo skewers.. Grill peaches, turning often, until prosciutto gets a little crisp around the edges and peaches begin to caramelize, about 6 minutes.. To serve, spoon burrata onto serving plates. Remove peaches from skewers; place several grilled peaches around cheese. Drizzle with olive oil. Top with a sprinkle of sea salt and pepper; garnish with basil.

name: Festive Olive and Cheese Appetizer
ingredients: {'quantity': '24', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'marinated mozzarella balls, drained'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted Castelvetrano olives, rinsed and dried'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted Kalamata olives, rinsed and drained'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sugar plum tomatoes'}
steps: Arrange rosemary sprigs in a 10-inch-diameter circle to resemble a wreath. Start by placing one sprig at a 45-degree angle with the leafy tip facing outwards. Continue adding sprigs in the same direction until you have formed a full circle.. Arrange clusters of mozzarella balls, olives, and tomatoes over rosemary sprigs.

name: Caprese Skewers
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) container', 'name': 'small fresh mozzarella balls'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10.5 ounce) container', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes, halved'}, {'quantity': '24', 'unit': '', 'name': 'small skewers, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Wrap each mozzarella ball with a basil leaf.. Thread a tomato half, a basil-wrapped mozzarella ball, and another tomato half onto a skewer. Repeat until all tomatoes are on skewers. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

name: Easy Caponata
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'stalk celery, chopped into 1/4-inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'eggplant, chopped into bite-size pieces'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell peppers, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'zucchini, cubed'}, {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'tomato puree (passata)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'black olives, pitted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'raisins'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'capers'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'basil, chopped'}
steps: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add celery and cook uncovered until softened, about 1 minute. Drain in a colander and immediately immerse in ice water for several minutes to stop the cooking process. Drain.. Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat; add onion and celery and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add eggplant, red bell peppers, and zucchini and cook until slightly softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in tomato puree, vinegar, and sugar. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes. Add olives, raisins, pine nuts, and capers. Season with salt and pepper and cook until flavors are well combined, about 5 minutes.. Remove skillet from heat; stir in chopped basil. Cool and serve at room temperature.

name: Roasted Peppers in Oil (Peperoni Arrostiti Sotto Olio)
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'fresh basil leaves, finely sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}
steps: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate. Reduce grill heat to medium.. Grill whole red, yellow, and orange bell peppers on the preheated grill until charred on all sides, turning about every 5 minutes. Place charred peppers in a resealable plastic bag and seal well. Allow peppers to cool in the bag.. Combine olive oil, garlic, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper in a 1-pint glass jar (or larger, depending on size of peppers).. Remove cooled peppers from the bag and scrape off charred skins. Cut peppers in half; remove seeds and stems. Slice peppers into long strips and place in oil mixture. Mix well, ensuring peppers are covered in oil.. Serve, storing leftover peppers in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

name: Tortellini Skewers
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(20 ounce) package', 'name': 'refrigerated tortellini'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pints', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pesto'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'toothpicks'}
steps: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil; stir in tortellini and return to a boil. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until tortellini float to the top, 5 to 6 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water.. Toss tortellini, cherry tomatoes, and pesto together in a large bowl until evenly coated.. Skewer 1 tortellini and 1 tomato on each toothpick; arrange on a tray. Keep refrigerated until serving.

name: Boniet
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'bunches', 'name': 'fresh parsley, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(2 ounce) can', 'name': 'anchovy fillets, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'tomato paste'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil'}
steps: In a medium bowl, toss together the parsley, anchovies and garlic. Stir in the tomato paste, vinegar and olive oil. Serve at room temperature.

name: Gluten-Free Stuffed Zucchini Blossoms (Fior di Zucca Ripieni)
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded fresh mozzarella cheese'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'zucchini blossoms'}, {'quantity': '7', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'rice flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sparkling water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sweet rice flour'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oil for frying'}
steps: Combine mozzarella cheese and Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese in a bowl until well mixed. Stuff each zucchini blossom with 1 tablespoon cheese mixture; pinch ends closed.. Whisk rice flour, eggs, milk, sparkling water, sweet rice flour, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl. Dip stuffed blossoms into rice flour mixture; toss gently until coated.. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Lower blossoms carefully into the hot oil in batches. Fry until crisp and pale golden brown, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Repeat with remaining blossoms.

name: Roasted Veggie Antipasto
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh green beans, cut into 1/2-inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'white onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, pressed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'broccoli, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'cauliflower, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomatoes, peeled and chopped'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'pitted black olives, drained and coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(5 ounce) jar', 'name': 'pitted green olives, drained and coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh basil, chopped'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'half-pint canning jars with lids and rings'}
steps: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).. Spread green, red, and yellow peppers, green beans, white onion, garlic, broccoli, cauliflower, celery, and mushrooms onto several baking sheets and drizzle with olive oil; toss lightly to coat.. Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven until slightly browned and softened, about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.. While vegetables are roasting, pour ketchup into a large pot over medium heat and stir in tomatoes, white vinegar, balsamic vinegar, salt, and black pepper; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes; stir in roasted vegetables, black olives, green olives, and basil. Simmer until cooked through, about 5 more minutes.. Sterilize jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes. Pack the roasted vegetable mixture into the sterilized jars, filling the jars to within 1/4 inch of the top. Run a knife or a thin spatula around the insides of the jars after they have been filled to remove any air bubbles. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue. Top with lids and screw on rings.. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water. Bring to a boil and lower jars into the boiling water using a holder. Leave a 2-inch space between the jars. Pour in more boiling water if necessary to bring the water level to at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars. Bring the water to a rolling boil, cover the pot, and process for 15 minutes.. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, for 24 hours. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all). Store in a cool, dark area.

name: Marinated Stuffed Cherry Peppers
ingredients: {'quantity': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cherry peppers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(7 ounce) package', 'name': 'mozzarella cheese'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}
steps: Cut a circle, at an inward angle, around pepper stems. Remove tops; scoop out seeds and membranes, like a tiny pumpkin.. Cut mozzarella into thumbnail-sized cubes, varying sizes slightly to fit each pepper. Cut prosciutto slices in half; wrap around mozzarella cubes. Stuff into pepper openings.. Add olive oil to a jar or lidded container. Whisk in Parmesan cheese, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, black pepper, and pepper flakes to combine.. Add peppers to oil mixture; seal the lid. Let marinate for 5 to 6 hours. Serve straight out of the jar.

name: Prosciutto Wrapped Melon Balls
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'honeydew melon, fruit removed with a melon baller'}, {'quantity': '9', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'thinly sliced prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '36', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh mint'}
steps: Place melon balls into a bowl, and sprinkle with lime juice. Stir gently to coat. Wrap each ball with a slice of prosciutto, and secure with a sprig of mint. Arrange on a serving tray. Refrigerate until serving.

name: Bruschetta with Peas and Mint
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'shallots, minced'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh or frozen peas'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'ciabatta bread'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, peeled'}
steps: Melt butter in a skillet and cook shallots and peas until soft, but not browned, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until coarsely pureed. Mix in mint.. Cut ciabatta slices in half and drizzle with olive oil. Cut garlic in half and rub onto each slice.. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Place ciabatta slices on a baking sheet and toast in the oven until lightly browned, about 3 minutes.. Remove from oven and spread with pea mixture. Serve immediately.

name: Grissini with Prosciutto
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(3 ounce) package', 'name': 'prosciutto'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(3 ounce) package', 'name': 'Italian breadsticks (grissini)'}
steps: Wrap 1 piece of prosciutto around each breadstick and arrange on a serving platter.

name: Easy Marinated Feta
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'feta cheese, cubed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'chile pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'herbes de Provence'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil, or as needed'}
steps: Place feta cheese in a glass jar. Add chile pepper, herbes de Provence, and lemon zest. Fill jar with olive oil so feta is completely covered and seal.. Marinate in a cool place, but not in the refrigerator, for 3 to 4 days. Remove chile pepper before serving.

name: Zucchini-Feta Rolls
ingredients: {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'zucchinis, thinly sliced lengthwise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 ounce) package', 'name': 'crumbled feta cheese'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dried Italian herbs'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}
steps: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet and cook zucchini slices in batches until soft and lightly browned on both sides, 5 to 10 minutes. Add more olive oil as needed. Remove zucchini slices from skillet and drain on paper towels.. Sprinkle zucchini slices with feta and roll up. Secure each roll with a tooth pick.. Set zucchini rolls into a dish that is as deep as the rolls are high, and sprinkle with garlic, Italian herbs, and balsamic vinegar. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 days.

name: Blackberry-Basil Skewers
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '(4 inch)', 'name': 'skewers'}, {'quantity': '24', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'fresh basil'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'blackberries'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'small fresh mozzarella balls'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'dried apricots'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'balsamic glaze, or to taste'}
steps: Assemble skewers in this order: basil leaf, blackberry, basil leaf, mozzarella ball, basil leaf, and a dried apricot.. Drizzle skewers with balsamic glaze and serve.

name: Cherry Tomato Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '18', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'creamy salad dressing (such as Miracle Whip®)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(3 ounce) can', 'name': 'bacon bits (such as Hormel®)'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green onions'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese (such as Sargento®)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley (Optional)'}
steps: Cut off the top 1/4 of each tomato and a very small slice off of the bottoms, if needed, to sit upright. Scoop out pulp using a baby spoon or grapefruit spoon. Place tomatoes cut-side down on paper towels to drain.. Combine salad dressing, bacon bits, green onions, Parmesan cheese, and parsley in a bowl. Spoon evenly into tomatoes. Cover and chill in a refrigerator until ready to serve.

name: Eggplant and Tomato Caponata
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Japanese eggplant, cut into 1/2-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': "fire-roasted tomatoes (such as Hunt's®)"}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red wine'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'capers'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'unsweetened cocoa powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'bay leaf'}
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; saute eggplant, onion, and garlic until lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Add tomatoes, red wine, and capers and simmer until heated through, about 5 minutes.. Mix oregano, cinnamon, allspice, cocoa powder, sugar, and bay leaf into eggplant mixture; simmer until thickened, 30 minutes. Add a few tablespoons water if mixture becomes too thick. Remove bay leaf.

name: Ruth's Eggplant Caponata
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'Japanese or other small eggplant, cut into 1/2-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'fire-roasted diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry red wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'bay leaf'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'capers, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}
steps: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook eggplant, onion, garlic, oregano, cinnamon, allspice, salt, and pepper, stirring frequently, until onion is slightly browned, 7 to 8 minutes.. Reduce heat to medium and add tomatoes, water, wine, and bay leaf. Simmer, stirring frequently, until eggplant is tender and mixture is thickened, 13 to 15 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in sugar, capers, and vinegar. Let cool 30 minutes, then discard bay leaf. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

name: Marinated Feta
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'black olives, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh sage leaves, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red chile pepper (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sprig', 'name': 'fresh rosemary, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'toasted sesame-ginger seasoning (such as Victoria Gourmet ®)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'small pepperoncini pepper, finely sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh oregano'}, {'quantity': '14', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'feta cheese, cubed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}
steps: Place a layer of olives, sage, garlic, chile pepper, rosemary, bell pepper, sesame-ginger seasoning, pepperoncini pepper, and oregano into the bottom of a container. Add a layer of feta cheese. Repeat layering with remaining ingredients.. Pour olive oil into the container to cover feta mixture completely. Cover and refrigerate until serving.

name: CDC Identifies Possible Source of Salmonella Outbreak Tied to Italian Meats
Magaricz
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'large eggplant, peeled and coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red bell pepper, cut into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, cut into thin strips'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coarsely shredded carrot'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'crushed red pepper flakes'}
steps: Place eggplant in a colander, lightly salt, and leave to drain for about 45 minutes.. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add eggplant, red and green bell peppers, onion, and carrot; stir to coat. Reduce heat to low, and cook for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until mixture resembles the consistency of coarse jam. Season to taste with salt and red pepper flakes.. Cover, and chill at least 1 hour. Serve chilled as a condiment with your favorite bread or crackers.
